bill_title: revise the notice requirements for closure of a highway and to provide a civil penalty for failure to comply with a closure.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the notice requirements for closure of a highway and to provide a civil penalty for failure to comply with a closure. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 31-4-14.2 be amended to read as follows: 31-4-14.2. Notice to the public that a state trunk highway is closed or its use is restricted shall be given in one or more of the following forms: (1) Erection of suitable barriers upon the highway to restrict or prohibit travel; (2) Post Issue warning and notice of the condition of the highway for travel in generally available media outlets; (3) Post signs for direction of traffic upon the highway relative to use or nonuse of the highway; (4) Place warning devices on the highway; or (5) Place flagmen to warn, detour, or direct traffic on the highway. Section 2. That § 31-4-14.3 be amended to read as follows: 31-4-14.3. Any person who intentionally fails to observe any sign, marker, warning, notice or direction, or barrier placed or given under § 31-4-14.2 is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor. Any unauthorized presence on a closed highway is prima facie evidence of a violation of this section. If, as a result of a violation of this section for failure to observe a notice provided pursuant to subdivision 31-4-14.2(1), (4), or (5) § 31-4-14.2, any agency of the State of South Dakota or any governmental subdivision incurs any costs for the purpose of rescuing the violator, any passengers, or the vehicle operated by the violator, the violator is civilly liable to the State of South Dakota for such costs, subject to a civil action by the State of South Dakota in circuit court for the recovery of a civil penalty of one thousand dollars and the actual cost of any such rescue, in an amount not to exceed ten thousand dollars.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the notice requirements for closure of a highway and to provide a civil penalty for failure to comply with a closure. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 31-4-14.2 be amended to read as follows: 31-4-14.2. Notice to the public that a state trunk highway is closed or its use is restricted shall be given in one or more of the following forms: (1) Erection of suitable barriers upon the highway to restrict or prohibit travel; (2) Post Issue warning and notice of the condition of the highway for travel in generally available media outlets; (3) Post signs for direction of traffic upon the highway relative to use or nonuse of the highway; (4) Place warning devices on the highway; or (5) Place flagmen to warn, detour, or direct traffic on the highway. Section 2. That § 31-4-14.3 be amended to read as follows: 31-4-14.3.
